alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 10:14PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Gilchrist and southwestern Alachua Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1013 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bell to Archer. Movement was north at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Bell and Archer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
